caption: This image features two prominent, tall trees under a dark blue, near-night sky. The trees, which appear leafless and somewhat desolate, have jagged, bare branches jutting out at various angles, with one tree taking more of a central position in the frame. The central tree's branches are stark and devoid of foliage, providing a skeletal visual against the rich, dark blue sky. No horizon or other environmental features are discernible, giving the composition a focus solely on these towering, sparse trees, which form somewhat of a vertical and angular contrast against the smooth backdrop of the sky. The image evokes a sense of stillness and might be reflective of winter or a dormant season. The lighting and focus add a bit of a mysterious or moody quality to the scene.
title: In August, 1973 a major forest fire swept through 17,470 acres of the western slopes of the Sierra Mountain range near Sonora skeletons of trees in the burn area known as "Granite Creek."
